CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total number of pixels that are shaded.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the total number of pixels that are shaded by the GPU, including on-screen and off-screen render passes.
This measure can be a slight overestimate because it assumes all pixels in each active {{C::MaliFragQueueTaskSize.equation}} x {{C::MaliFragQueueTaskSize.equation}} pixel region are shaded. If the rendered region does not align with {{C::MaliFragQueueTaskSize.equation}} pixel aligned boundaries, then this metric includes pixels that are not actually shaded.

CounterInfo.LongDescription:

This measure can be a slight overestimate because it assumes all pixels in each active {{C::MaliFragQueueTaskSize.equation}} x {{C::MaliFragQueueTaskSize.equation}} pixel region are shaded. CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The total number of pixels that are shaded.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the total number of pixels that are shaded by the GPU, including on-screen and off-screen render passes.
This measure can be a slight overestimate because it assumes all pixels in each active {{C::MaliMainQueueTaskSize.equation}} x {{C::MaliMainQueueTaskSize.equation}} pixel region are shaded. If the rendered region does not align with {{C::MaliMainQueueTaskSize.equation}} pixel aligned boundaries, then this metric includes pixels that are not actually shaded.

CounterInfo.ShortDescription: The average number of GPU cycles spent per pixel rendered.
CounterInfo.LongDescription:
This expression defines the average number of GPU cycles being spent per pixel rendered. This includes the cost of all shader stages.
It is a useful exercise to set a cycle budget for each render pass in your application, based on your target resolution and frame rate. Rendering 1080p60 is possible with an entry-level device, but you have a small number of cycles per pixel to work so must use them efficiently.
